page.title: 02FARMING IN BETHERSDEN
page.content: THE SOIL FARMED IS WEALDEN CLAY,HEAVY AND WET;SOME FARMERS INVEST IN DEEP MOLE DRAINAGE TO ALLEVIATE THIS.MOST OF THE 14 FARMS GROW AT LEAST 1 CEREAL CROP.FLOCKS OF KENT AND ROMNEY MARSH OR TEXEL SHEEP ARE KEPT;THE LAMBS ARE SOLD FOR MEAT AT THE LOCAL ASHFORD MARKET;THE ADULTS ARE KEPT FOR BREEDING AND THEIR FLEECES.A DAIRY HERD OF AYRSHIRES FEED ON GRASS AND KALE IN THE SUMMER;THEY ARE WINTERED INDOORS AND FED SILAGE AND SUPPLEMENTS .SMALL NUMBERS OF BEEF CATTLE ARE REARED AND SOLD IN THE NEARBY MARKET. RAPE IS GROWN FOR ITS OIL,SOLD WITHIN THE E.E.C..PIGS ARE FED TO STRINGENT STANDARDS TO MINIMISE FAT,REARED IN INTENSIVE UNITS.TURKEYS AND GEESE MATURE FOR SALE AT CHRISTMAS TIME. THERE IS A GARDEN CENTRE AND AN AWARD -WINNING FUSCHIA NURSERY.
